Articles.Content:
If i wanted to get the texture and model of the original MKI pod for a prop in 3D... stuff, how would i get it?

P.S. i have the 1.3.3 demo version on my computer.

EDIT: i tried importing the .DAE file into blender, but it gives me an error message saying "Error found parsing collada document"

EDIT2: also, i'm on a mac

Edited May 14, 2013 by rewdew2

If i wanted to get the texture and model of the original MKI pod for a prop in 3D... stuff, how would i get it?

P.S. i have the 1.3.3 demo version on my computer.

EDIT: i tried importing the .DAE file into blender, but it gives me an error message saying "Error found parsing collada document"

EDIT2: also, i'm on a mac

Import them into 3dsmax if you havevit, works fine in there.

EDIT: i tried importing the .DAE file into blender, but it gives me an error message saying "Error found parsing collada document"

Take your .DAE file and make a copy of it.

Open the copy with a text processor

Find all the <diffuse></diffuse> tags, and delete anything between the tag pairs.

Save it.

The copy should now open in Blender

Take your .DAE file and make a copy of it.

Open the copy with a text processor

Find all the <diffuse></diffuse> tags, and delete anything between the tag pairs.

Save it.

The copy should now open in Blender

Thanks, that fixed it
In Blender, you will have to find all the materials, make a new texture for them, have the texture of type Image, load the appropriate file, and set the mapping from Generated to UV
